meanings.definition: A gesture of respect or greeting, typically involving a hand movement to the forehead.
meanings.sent1: During the ceremony, the soldier gave a salute to the general.
meanings.sent2: The captain returned the salute to the young cadet.
meanings.sent3: The cat did a playful salute with its paw to the bird outside.
meanings.sent4: The sun's rays seemed to salute the earth as they shone brightly.
meanings.sent5: The salute from the old man was filled with kindness and respect.

meanings.definition: To honor or show respect to someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The students salute their teacher at the end of each class.
meanings.sent2: People often salute the flag during national anthems.
meanings.sent3: The dog seemed to salute the squirrel it saw in the park.
meanings.sent4: The artist's masterpiece seemed to salute the beauty of nature.
meanings.sent5: The community came together to salute the heroes of the town.

meanings.definition: To greet or address with an expression of good will.
meanings.sent1: Neighbors salute each other with a smile every morning.
meanings.sent2: In some cultures, it is customary to salute guests with a bow.
meanings.sent3: The flowers seemed to salute the bees buzzing around them.
meanings.sent4: The music seemed to salute the listeners with its joyful melody.
meanings.sent5: The chef would always salute his customers with a warm welcome.
